column4: yes and no. I'm sure you can run the client software on other distros, but depending on how the nautilus plugins work it may be a lot of work to integrate it with a precompiled version of nautilus shipped with some other distro
so it would be a lot of hard work probably is what you are saying. Thank you, I was just curious.
it may not be work at all. I would look into how nautilus plugins work. If they don't need to be built in at compile time it should be easy
Okay, I shall google it now. Thank you.
